page.title: 11Housing
page.content: The oldest types of building which can be seen in Milborne have cob walls,some cottages still have thatched roofs. The rendered walls have been painted to look more attractive. Many of the buildings are constructed of brick and flint, these include the Church and the school.Most of the more modern housing is brick_ built.Three private estates have been built during the last twenty years, together with several private houses and two terraces of houses, one of which is now owned by the Council.Many previous council house tenants have purchased their properties. so that a greater proportion of the houses are now owner_ocupied rather than leased.The latest private development,currently being completed is built next to the school,and consists of ten mock_Georgian houses.
